TV Production In St. Louis
Father Murphy Reports Pressure
Tremendous
Father Eugene P. Murphy, S.J., and
his staff have found the weekly produc¬
tion of the Sacred Heart TV program
such a grinding ordeal that they re-or¬
ganized their whole set-up and made
Father Hugh Harkins, S.J., producer-
manager of the TV program. What
Father Schwienher does for the Sacred
Heart radio transcription—this Father
Harkins will do for the weekly films. At
Technisonic Studios, as technical advisor,
Mr. Charles Harrison, now produces 100
Sacred Heart transcriptions daily, and 10
Sacred Heart films weekly. Stress is be¬
ing placed on mastery of their topic and
easy, convincing and pleasant delivery of
their materials by each of the TV speak¬
ers. Buffalo friends will be glad to know
that Father Charles Dolan, S.J., of the
Canisius High School faculty did two ex¬
cellent films while in St. Louis recently.
These will be seen on our WGR program
soon. Congratulations to Fr. Murphy and
Mr. Harrison!
FATHER TWIGG-PORTER, S. J.
Grand News from San Francisco
From our San Francisco offices comes
word that Father George Twigg-Porter,
S.J., has been appointed full-time direc¬
tor of the Program on the West Coast.
Father has just finished his long course
of training as a Jesuit. To date he has
been only able to devote what free time
was available over and above his studies
and teaching, to the Sacred Heart Pro¬
gram. Father brings enthusiasm and out¬
standing ability to his assignment. His
appointment is good news—and is one of
the finest assurances we have had in re¬
cent years that the Program will go for¬
ward in the years ahead.
CHRISTMAS NOVENA
PRAYER
DECEMBER 16-24
Let us pray, Hasten, we be¬
seech Thee, O Lord, do not de¬
lay, and grant us the assistance
of Thy grace from above that
we who confide in Thy good¬
ness, may be aided by the con¬
solation of Thy coming, Who
livest and reignest with the
Father and the Holy Spirit,
God, world without end. Amen.
N. B. Please join us in making this No¬
vena in preparation for the coming of Our
Infant Saviour. If unable to join us on the
radio, recite the above prayer privately,
December 16 to 24. Kindly return enclosed
intention slip by December 24.
R.I.P.
In your kindness please remember
the souls of the following good friends
of the Sacred Heart Program, recently
deceased: Rev. Harold B. Hinds, Rev.
Arthur R. Campbell, S.J., Mrs. Eliza¬
beth B. Burke, Mrs. Elizabeth Smith,
Miss Alma Mary Cotter.
FATHER HINDS
On October 11, 1955, our Sacred Heart
Program lost its beloved and devoted
friend, Father Harold B. Hinds, pastor of
St. John Baptist Church, Schenectady.
That morning Father Hinds went to re¬
ceive the reward of his manifold aposto-
lates—not the least of which was his
sponsoring of our Sacred Heart Program
in the Albany diocese for fifteen years.
One of the memorials to Father is the
Co-missionaries of the Sacred Heart, a
group of over 200 shut-ins in the area
who devote their prayers, joys and suf¬
ferings to the Sacred Heart apostolate.
They are under the direction of Miss
Margaret Mullarkey in Schenectady,
from whom they receive a letter each
month. May he rest in Peace!
HOME STUDY COURSE
John McGrath, S.J., Looks for Applicants
Fr. John McGrath, S.J., director of our
Sacred Heart correspondence course, re¬
ports that a full corps of theologians
have volunteered to conduct instructions
on the Catholic Faith by mail. He says
they can take on seventy more applicants.
Perhaps you know a non-Catholic who
would like to take such a course.
Send names to: Home Study Course,
Weston College, Weston 93, Mass.
Instructions are free of charge.

keep paying our way as we grow.
Please join us in our Christmas novena
from December 16 to December 24. It
will be on 31 stations in this northeast
area. There is so much commercialism in
our preparation for the coming of the
Christ-Child that we should join in such
a fervent novena so as to offset this sad
tendency. On page four you will find
our novena prayer.
God Bless you with a most Happy
Christmas and a Bright New Year.
Matthew Hale, S.J.
THE DIME-A-WEEK CLUBS
Grand Subsidy for Sacred Heart
Program
Again our all-out thanks go to our Sa¬
cred Heart Dime-a-Week Clubs. Very
many new members have joined the ranks
as Captains and Ptomoters. The figures
quoted below for each club speak for
themselves. As the Sacred Heart will
never be outdone in generosity, they be¬
speak a rich reward. May we not con¬
sider the dime each associate gives each
week as the cup of cold water given in
His Name of which our Lord said: it “will
not go without its reward.” On account of
the floods the annual meeting of our
zealous Connecticut Clubs had to be post¬
poned.

HOLY HOUR
As promotor of our Holy Hour—on the 1st Wednesday of each month, 6.45 p.m., at
St. Clement’s Shrine, Mrs. Del Vecchio distributes badges, league leaflets and our
‘NEWS & VIEWS”. She has led the way in Father Hale’s efforts as Archdiocesan Di¬
rector of the Apostleship of Prayer, to make the Holy Hour a prayerful apostolate for
extending the League of The Sacred Heart in the parishes. This, she has done at
St. Cecilia’s parish, Boston, by zealous cooperation with Monsignor Phelan, Father
Cogavin and Father Tangney. Over 300 have joined the league in the parish and
attend the weekly Holy Hour there. The goal is 1000 members.
